Create a "Task Completion Club" - This is a club where members share their experiences and strategies for completing tasks efficiently. Members can share their tips and tricks, and learn from each other's experiences. This can help to alleviate feelings of jealousy by fostering a sense of community and collaboration.

Set realistic goals - Sometimes, feelings of jealousy can stem from unrealistic expectations. Set specific, achievable goals for yourself, and break them down into smaller, manageable tasks. This can help to build a sense of accomplishment and progress, which can reduce feelings of jealousy.

Practice gratitude - Take time each day to reflect on the things you are grateful for. This can help to shift your focus away from feelings of jealousy and towards the positive aspects of your life. You can use a gratitude journal, or simply take a few moments each day to think about the things you are thankful for.

Find the source of the jealousy - Sometimes, feelings of jealousy can stem from a specific source, such as a colleague or friend who seems to be able to complete tasks more easily. Try to identify the source of the jealousy, and address it directly. This can help to reduce feelings of inadequacy and jealousy.

Embrace your unique work style - Everyone has their own unique work style, and it's important to embrace yours. Rather than comparing yourself to others, focus on your own strengths and weaknesses, and find ways to work effectively within your own style. This can help to reduce feelings of jealousy and increase productivity and motivation.
